oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Confederate Monument

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Monuments; Soldiers
United States - History - Civil War, 1861-1865; Murfreesboro (Tenn.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Confederate monument in Murfreesboro. The monument consists of a large limestone base with bronze inscription topped with a statue of a Confederate soldier with a rifle.
The monument was erected in 1901. A crowd of 3,000 people (including hundreds of veterans) gathereed to watch the dedication of the memorial.
